New Records: Victor Wembanyama set a career-high with 50 points.
Wembanyama is the first player in league history with 20 three-pointers and 25 blocks over a six-game span.
Wembanyama is the fourth-youngest player to score 50 points.
Wembanyama is the eighth player in Spurs franchise history to score 50 points.
Key Match Events: Wembanyama made an 18-foot jumper for his 49th and 50th points with 8:49 remaining to give San Antonio a 115-98 lead.
Wembanyama started quickly against the Wizards, draining three-pointers from 25 and 28 feet as the Spurs raced to a 13-3 lead.
Wembanyama had 24 points in the first half and then matched his highest production for any half with 26 in the final two quarters.
Post-Match Reflections: Wembanyama expressed a desire for future performances to overshadow his 50-point game.
Chris Paul praised Wembanyama's performance as very impressive.
Julian Champagnie highlighted Wembanyama's mindset and work ethic.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wembanyama was 8 for 16 on three-pointers, establishing a career-high.
Alexandre Sarr blocked Wembanyama's shot in the second quarter and dunked on him in the third quarter.
